      • heuristic

        public float heuristic(int x1,
              int y1,
              int x2,
              int y2)
        This function will calculate the euclidean distance between two points.
        Parameters:
        x1 - X-coordinate of the first point.
        y1 - Y-coordinate of the first point.
        x2 - X-coordinate of the second point.
        y2 - Y-coordinate of the second point.
        Returns:
        The distance between the points.

      • theProcessor

        public java.util.Stack<AStar.Node> theProcessor()
        This function is responsible for processing a breadth first search of a tree and using the A* algorithm, it will return a stack containing the moves that will result in the shortest path. Please look online for the full description of how the A* algorithm works as there is too much to say about it here. Since we do not have access to the final position right off, we have to do at least one search of entire maze to find the final position. It is used in the process to calculate the distances F, G and H.
        Returns:
        The path to the finish or an empty stack if there is no path.

      • reconstruct_path

        public java.util.Stack<AStar.Node> reconstruct_path(AStar.Node current)
        This function will reconstruct a path through a tree.
        Parameters:
        current - The node we need a path to.
        Returns:
        A stack containing the nodes that will have to be traversed to reach the 'current' node.

      • BFS

        public void BFS(AStar.Node start)
        This function will produce a breadth first search of a maze.
        Parameters:
        start - The starting position.
